ad_hominem.name: Ad Hominem
ad_hominem.description: Attacking the person instead of their argument
ad_hominem.example: You can't trust his economic policy because he's wealthy

appeal_to_authority.name: Appeal to Authority
appeal_to_authority.example: This diet works because a celebrity uses it

appeal_to_emotion.name: Appeal to Emotion
appeal_to_emotion.example: We must ban this because it's scary

false_dilemma.name: False Dilemma
false_dilemma.description: Presenting only two options when more exist
false_dilemma.example: Either support the war or hate your country

begging_question.name: Begging the Question
begging_question.description: Circular reasoning - conclusion assumed in premise
begging_question.example: God exists because the Bible says so, and the Bible is true because God wrote it

hasty_generalization.name: Hasty Generalization
hasty_generalization.description: Drawing broad conclusion from insufficient evidence
hasty_generalization.example: I met two rude people from that city, so everyone there is rude

slippery_slope.name: Slippery Slope
slippery_slope.description: Claiming small step leads to extreme outcome without justification
slippery_slope.example: If we allow same-sex marriage, people will marry animals

equivocation.name: Equivocation
equivocation.description: Using same word with different meanings
equivocation.example: A feather is light; light travels fast; therefore a feather travels fast

affirming_consequent.name: Affirming the Consequent
affirming_consequent.description: If P then Q; Q; therefore P (invalid)
affirming_consequent.example: If it rains, the ground is wet; the ground is wet; therefore it rained

denying_antecedent.name: Denying the Antecedent
denying_antecedent.description: If P then Q; not P; therefore not Q (invalid)
denying_antecedent.example: If it rains, the ground is wet; it's not raining; therefore the ground is dry
